connector.description:
Send Messages to Azure Storage queues.

The Kamelet is able to understand the following headers to be set:

- `expiration` / `ce-expiration`: as the time to live of the message in the queue.

If the header won't be set the default of 7 days will be used.

The format should be in this form: PnDTnHnMn.nS., e.g: PT20.345S — parses as 20.345 seconds, P2D — parses as 2 days.

camel.kamelet.azure-storage-queue-sink.a.name: camel.kamelet.azure-storage-queue-sink.accountName
camel.kamelet.azure-storage-queue-sink.a.description: The Azure Storage Queue account name.

camel.kamelet.azure-storage-queue-sink.q.name: camel.kamelet.azure-storage-queue-sink.queueName
camel.kamelet.azure-storage-queue-sink.q.description: The Azure Storage Queue container name.

camel.kamelet.azure-storage-queue-sink.a.name: camel.kamelet.azure-storage-queue-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.azure-storage-queue-sink.a.description: The Azure Storage Queue access Key.
